Quality Education.reason: explicitly aims to 'be well-equipped with English language skills in job hunting' and 'deal with and communicate effectively in major business contexts'
evidence: The course has four parts: job preparation, communication at work, persuasive speech training, and business awareness building.
Course Objectives: The course aims to help students to achieve the following goals upon finishing the course. They shall 1. be well-equipped with English language skills in job hunting
be able to deal with and communicate effectively in major business contexts.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: explicit focus on career prospects and interview/negotiation skills: 'Career Prospect & Networks', 'Communicating at work 1: Negotiating', and 'Job Interview Skills 1'

No Poverty.reason: The course focuses on 'job preparation', 'job hunting', and 'career plan', which equip students with skills to secure employment and generate income, indirectly contributing to poverty reduction.

Quality Education.reason: The course itself is an educational offering, aiming to 'help students to achieve goals' by providing 'English language skills' and 'professional communication skills'.
evidence: The course aims to help students to achieve the following goals upon finishing the course.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course directly addresses 'job preparation', 'communication at work', 'negotiating', and 'business awareness building', which are crucial for employability and economic participation. It also mentions 'social responsibility'.
evidence: understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course's focus on 'business awareness building' and 'discussion of current business issues' could tangentially touch upon industry trends, but not the development of infrastructure or innovation.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: Core competence B explicitly states students will 'understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues', which relates to responsible business practices.
evidence: understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: The course includes 'crisis management' and aims for students to 'understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility', which are foundational for strong and just institutions in business.
evidence: understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course teaches 'negotiating' and 'teamwork', which are skills for collaboration, but it does not explicitly mention partnerships for global sustainable development goals.
evidence: work effectively in teams as well as develop leadership skills.
